data.chText: 仗势欺人者；横行霸道者
data.enText: a person who uses their strength or power to frighten or hurt weaker people
to frighten or hurt a weaker person; to use your strength or power to make sb do sth

data.chText: 我儿子在学校里受欺负。
data.enText: My son is being bullied at school.

data.chText: 我绝不会屈服于压力签署任何东西。
data.enText: I won't be bullied into signing anything.

data.chText: 很多学校都出现学生仗势作恶的问题。
data.enText: Bullying is a problem in many schools.

data.chText: 他拒不向恐吓威逼势力让步。
data.enText: He refused to give in to bullying and threats.
used to show that you do not think that what sb has said or done is very impressive

data.chText: 他在纽约找到了份工作？哼，那没什么了不起！
data.enText: He's got a job in New York? Well, bully for him!

simple_means.memory_skill: bull 公牛 + y 表行为 → 像公牛一样吓唬别人 → 欺侮

ex.chText: 在学校里，淘气的男生常欺负女生。
ex.enText: Naughty boys often bully girls at school.
He was bullied into telling lies to her.

synonyms.bx: 尤指以大欺小、恃强凌弱，或是通过施加压力迫使别人做某事，作后者解时，常与介词 into 连用。

ex.chText: 我不会在他们的胁迫下透露她的秘密。
ex.enText: I won't let myself be bludgeoned into telling them her secrets.

synonyms.bx: 指通过威胁或争吵强迫某人做某事，常与介词 into 连用。

ex.chText: 示威者不应该屈服于警察的威胁。
ex.enText: The protesters should not be cowed into submission by the police.

synonyms.bx: 指通过威胁使某人做某事，通常用被动语态，且常与介词 into 连用。

ex.chText: 我的老板试图对我作威作福。
ex.enText: My boss tried to domineer over me.

synonyms.bx: 指专横霸道、盛气凌人，常后接介词 over。

data.enText: used to show that you do not think that what sb has said or done is very impressive

data.chText: 他在纽约找到了份工作？哼，那没什么了不起！
data.enText: He's got a job in New York? Well, bully for him!

tr: discourage or frighten with threats or a domineering manner

example: Her big brother always bullied her when she was young
had a great time at the party

value.def: A bully is someone who uses their strength or power to hurt or frighten other people.

example.ex: I fell victim to the office bully...
example.tran: 我成了这个办公室霸王欺侮的对象。

example.ex: He's a coward and a bully who confuses physical strength with manhood.
example.tran: 他是一个懦夫，一个分不清蛮力和大丈夫气概的恃强凌弱者。

value.def: If someone bullies you, they use their strength or power to hurt or frighten you.

example.ex: I wasn't going to let him bully me...
example.tran: 我可不打算任由他欺负。

example.ex: I asked her if she was bullied by the other children.
example.tran: 我问她有没有被别的孩子欺负。
受大孩子欺负的小学生

value.def: If someone bullies you into something, they make you do it by using force or threats.

example.ex: We think an attempt to bully them into submission would be counterproductive...
example.tran: 我们认为试图迫使他们屈服会适得其反。

example.ex: She used to bully me into doing my schoolwork...
example.tran: 她过去总是强迫我写作业。

example.ex: The government says it will not be bullied by the press.
example.tran: 政府声称不会屈服于新闻媒体的压力。

trans: 名望讲坛(能提供机会阐明自己观点的重要公职)

partsOfSpeech.dec: bu 牛 + col 共同 + ic …的 → 牧人的；田园的
bu 牛 +〔an〕gle 角 → 牛角做的军号 → 军号
bull 公牛 + y 表行为 → 像公牛一样吓唬别人 → 欺侮
